ai:cl.c: Manages user settings for proxy servers.

ai:a.c: Permanently saves user configurable settings for a proxy.

ai:m.c: Removes a proxy from the database.
Search for a proxy that matches a set of filters.
ai:m.p: ERR prx::Find(OBJECTPTR Object, INT Port, INT Enabled)

ai:i.c: The port number to access. If zero, all proxies will be returned if you perform a looped search.
Set to true to return only enabled proxies, false for disabled proxies or -1 for all proxies.

ai:f.c: All proxies are enabled by default until this field is set to false.
The IP address of the gateway that the proxy is limited to.
If true, the proxy settings are derived from the host operating system's default settings.
The name of the network that the proxy is limited to.
The password to use when authenticating against the proxy server.
Defines the ports supported by this proxy.
A human readable name for the proxy server entry.
The unique ID of the current proxy record.
The destination address of the proxy server - may be an IP address or resolvable domain name.
The port that is used for proxy server communication.
The username to use when authenticating against the proxy server.
